column5: I do not have a drug plan. Help please!!!

COLD FX - It has saved my behind more than once... 2006 Quinte GTG, for example. Woke up the day before the event with the beginnings of a nasty cold/flu. The stuff kept me on my feet, fishin and perhaps a little beverage time as well! Follow the instructions on the bottle and it should work. I've recommended the stuff to quite a few people and 50% said it helped them a lot and 50% said it did nothing. I'm fortunate enough to fall into the 50% that it works for! Hey Don Cherry can't be wrong all the time! HH
Both flu and colds are caused by viruses, and once you got em, there isn't much you can do except rest in bed, drink plenty of fluids, and take Aspirin.  No drug plan necessary.
One that works well for me when I am sick.  A shot or two of Yukon Jack.  A shot of Nyquil.  Hit the bed wearing a touque and hoody to sweat it out.  Usually gone in a day or two.

Might sound a little far fetched (if your not feeling well), but when I was younger and got a cold in the winter, I would go play a game of hockey or run on a treadmill to sweat it out. Combined with as much orange juice as I could drink, and soup I could eat. Also...(sorry to be gross), but the more fluids you get out of your body (spitting), the better as well.  Hope this helps.
As douG says cold and flu virus's run their course. I find good ol' chicken soup and the odd single malt works wonders.....
DouG has it right...unless it's bacterial, expensive antibiotics will do nothing for you.

There is also a yogic practice of flushing out your sinuses with warm salt water using something called a neti pot (go ahead and google it).  They say it helps when you get a cold.  Never tried it tho.
Hot rum toddies !

Poppy tea . my dear old grand ma had a backyard garden full of poppys , she would dry out the seed pods and at the first sign of a cold she would take three or so of these dryed pods and grid them up fine and steep into a tea (if you dont have any poppies in your garden the dryed pods can be bought at most dry flower suppiers ). Add lots of suger it tasted horrid if I remember but that was the end of any cold . Or maybe I just dreamed this lol

(1) 16 oz. bottle of Castor Oil  (1) 2 oz. bottle of Tobasco sauce  (1) small tube gold or silver glitter  Mix all ingredients together and warm to 110*F... administer as an enema. Take a tin of coca cola (not diet) pour it in a microwaveable glass or mug and heat in the microwave until very hot. Drink with 2 tylenol cold and sinus or cold and flu tablets before going to bed. Wake up able to slough through the next day... I am a very light sleeper and when I have taken the above I sleep deeply which I believe helps more than anything.
